title: Esthetics

articles.content:
The fifth and last branch of philosophy is esthetics, the study of art, which
is based on metaphysics, epistemology and ethics.
articles.attribution:
“Philosophy: Who Needs It,”
Philosophy: Who Needs It, 4

articles.content:
The esthetic principles which apply to all art, regardless of an individual
artist’s philosophy, and which must guide an objective evaluation . . . are
defined by the science of esthetics—a task at which modern philosophy has
failed dismally.
articles.attribution:
“Art and Sense of Life,”
The Romantic Manifesto, 42

articles.content:
The position of art in the scale of human knowledge is, perhaps, the most
eloquent symptom of the gulf between man’s progress in the physical sciences
and his stagnation (or, today, his retrogression) in the humanities . . . .
articles.attribution:
“The Psycho-Epistemology of Art,”
The Romantic Manifesto, 15

acknowledgement:
“Philosophy: Who Needs It,”
Philosophy: Who Needs It, 4
